700507f-a.text:
1361 to 1365 Boston Road, adjoining the S.W. corner of Jefferson Place, showing the dennings Homestead, also known as the "01d Stone Jug" and "Drovers' Inn." It was built in the middle of the 18th century. Its site is now (G.W. Bromley map of 1923 as revised to September 1932) occupded by a 5-story apartment house (No. 1361-63) and a 1-story brickstructure (No. 1365). For additional data see The Story of the Bronx,
Page 35 by R. Comfort.
1901.
Cift of Randall Comfort.
700507f-a.folder: Boston Road & Jefferson Place, Bronx, NY
